column4: http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/ <-- How do I add this to my sources.list ?
it is not a proper PPA you cannot add it to your sources.list
So its not possible to automaticly make sure that my distro are updated with the latest Linux kernel?
not with the latest upstream versions no
why do you need mainline kernels over the ubuntu offerings?
because I want the latest hyperv LIC 2.1 which is included in 3.6.35.. 2.0 is included in 2.6.32
so the maverick kernel is v2.6.35 based, you could try the lts-backports kernel
but in general the mainline kernels are for testing only they are not recommended or supported for ongoing use; we do not even verify they boot
philinux: cool.. where can I read about the lts-backported kernel?
is lts-backported kernels tested.. that they boot?
it is not yet officially in the archive, it cannot be until release but it does exist in the kernel-ppa user's actual PPA in launchpad
the lts-backports kernel does indeed get tested as it is the maverick kernel
ok.. whats the apt source line to use then?
so its safe to use in production enviroment?
where security updates also is critical.
it has the same updates applied as maverick, though it may be 1-2 days behind
